content:
From:           calydon@aol.com (Calydon)
Date:           19 Apr 1998 20:32:10 GMT
Newsgroups:     sci.math.research
Subject:        Cube Dissection

Can anyone offer a simple proof or disproof that 9 is the fewest number of
pieces
into which a cube can be dissected so that the pieces so obtained may be used
to construct 3 cubes? Calydon@aol.com (Great Calydon)
